channel.title: Modifying the SMF repository
channel.description: How does one go about doing it? I see no guides about how to set it up and modify it, which is odd when the answer to every single suggestion is "the source is on github modify it yourself".

item.title: Modifying the SMF repository
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:4, topic:545248”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=664128.msg4439378#msg4439378 date=1406052247]
Tom said he was going to give us the db structure (and the important data like settings) which we kinda need to modify anything important. Need to wait for that. Besides that, it’s just git usage which you can google.
[/quote]

I know how to use git I’ve forked the repo and have cloned it onto my computer but have no idea how to set the smf up.[/quote]
I feel like you’d have to get a current version of smf and then add what’s missing from the github
And you probably just install it onto your site (like for “local” testing). Just, without the install.php (edit the settings and go from there?)

Read full topic
